sen.j: 中井敬所（なかい けいしょ、天保2年（1831年） - 明治42年（1909年））は、明治時代の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Keisho NAKAI (1831 - 1909) is a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving).
Keisho NAKAI (1831 - 1909) is a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: 明治時代の：訳もれです。
sen.e: Keisho NAKAI (1831 - 1909) is a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in Meiji Period.

sen.j: 篆刻家としてだけでなく日本印章学の基礎を築いた学者としても知られる。
sen.e: Not only as a tenkokuka, but also he is known as the scholar who laid the foundations for Japanese sigillography.
He is known not only as a tenkokuka but also as the scholar who laid the foundations for Japanese sigillography.
He is known not only as a tenkokuka but also as the scholar who laid the foundations for Japanese sigillography.

sen.j: 名を兼之、字を資同、敬所は号。
sen.e: His real name is 兼之, his common name 資同, and Keisho is his go (kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately).
sen.cmt: 兼之：読み方不明です。資同：読み方不明です。
sen.e: His real name is 兼之, his common name 資同, and Keisho is his go (kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately).
His real name is 兼之, his common name 資同, and Keisho is his go (kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately).
He was born in Honjo, Edo.
He was born in Honjo, Edo.
He was born in Honjo, Edo.
His original family name is Moriyama.
His original family name is Moriyama.
His original family name is Moriyama.

sen.j: 幼少期から外叔父である浜村蔵六 (三世)に就いて篆刻を学び、13歳で益田遇所に入門。
sen.e: From early childhood, he studied tenkoku (seal-engraving) with his maternal uncle, Zoroku HAMAMURA (Ⅲ), and become a disciple of Gusho MASUDA at the age of 13.
From early childhood, he studied tenkoku (seal-engraving) with his maternal uncle, Zoroku HAMAMURA (Ⅲ), and become a disciple of Gusho MASUDA at the age of 13.
From early childhood, he studied tenkoku (seal-engraving) with his maternal uncle, Zoroku HAMAMURA (Ⅲ), and become a disciple of Gusho MASUDA at the age of 13.

sen.j: 二人の師はともに高芙蓉の流れを受けた江戸篆刻界の大物であった。
sen.e: Two of his masters were big deals in the Edo tenkoku world belonging to Fuyo KO.
Two of his masters were big deals in the Edo tenkoku world belonging to Fuyo KO.
Two of his masters were big deals in the Edo tenkoku world belonging to Fuyo KO.

sen.j: 22歳のときに中井家の養子となり、家職である鋳金に従事。
sen.e: At the age of 22, he was adopted to the Nakai family to engage their family business, metal-casting.
At the age of 22, he was adopted to the Nakai family to engage their family business, metal-casting.
At the age of 22, he was adopted to the Nakai family to engage their family business, metal-casting.

sen.j: 明治維新以降、篆刻家として本格的に活動をはじめ、中国の篆刻を熱心に学び、作品に取り入れた。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he became a serious tenkokuka, and earnestly studied tenkoku in Chaina to bring the essence into his work.
After the Meiji Restoration, he became a serious tenkokuka, and earnestly studied tenkoku in China to bring the essence into his work.
sen.cmt: Chaina ⇒ China に訂正しました。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he became a serious tenkokuka, and earnestly studied tenkoku in China to bring the essence into his work.

sen.j: 陰刻は中国の篆刻家一覧、とりわけ陳豫鐘の影響を受け、陽刻は鄧石如の作風を好んだ。
sen.e: His inkoku (incised character) was influenced by the Chinese tenkokuka catalog especially Chen Yuzhong, and as for yokoku (raised character), he favored the style of Deng Shiru.
sen.cmt: 篆刻家一覧：定訳不明です。
sen.e: His inkoku (incised character) was influenced by the Chinese tenkokuka catalog especially Chen Yuzhong, and as for yokoku (raised character), he favored the style of Deng Shiru.
His inkoku (incised character) was influenced by the Chinese tenkokuka catalog especially Chen Yuzhong, and as for yokoku (raised character), he favored the style of Deng Shiru.

sen.j: 明治印壇で保守派の代表的印人となり、菡萏居社にて多くの門弟を育てた。
sen.e: He became the most famous conservative engraver of tenkoku in the seal world of the Meiji period, and developed a lot of disciples in Kantankyo-sha School.
sen.cmt: 印壇：定訳不明です。菡萏居社：定訳不明です。
sen.e: He became the most famous conservative engraver of tenkoku in the seal world of the Meiji period, and developed a lot of disciples in Kantankyo-sha School.
He became the most famous conservative engraver of tenkoku in the seal world of the Meiji period, and developed a lot of disciples in Kantankyo-sha School.

sen.j: また中国や日本の古印の研究にも力を注ぎ、優れた著作を遺した。
sen.e: He also studied hard about old seals of China and Japan, and left remarkable literary works.
He also studied hard about old seals of China and Japan, and left remarkable literary works.
He also studied hard about old seals of China and Japan, and left remarkable literary works.

sen.j: 明治13年（1880年）に国璽を刻し明治政府に献上する。
sen.e: In 1880, he carved the seal of state to present to the Meiji Government.
In 1880, he carved the seal of state to present to the Meiji Government.
In 1880, he carved the seal of state to present to the Meiji Government.

sen.j: その後、第3回内国勧業博覧会審査官・臨時全国宝物取調局査掛などを歴任し、明治39年（1906年）、篆刻家として初めて帝室技芸員に選出される。
sen.e: After that, he served in a variety of posts such as the examiner of the third National Industrial Exhibition and Bureau for provisional national inspection of treasure, and in 1906, he became the first kenkokuka who was elected as Teishitsu Gigeiin (Imperial art expert).

After that, he served in a variety of posts such as the examiner of the third National Industrial Exhibition and Bureau for provisional national inspection of treasure, and in 1906, he became the first kenkokuka who was elected as Teishitsu Gigeiin (Imperial art expert).
